title: Hector Bellerin believed to be open to Barcelona move… if Arsene Wenger leaves Arsenal
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments HECTOR BELLERIN is reportedly open to a potential Barcelona return this summer, if Arsene Wenger leaves the club. 
The right-back has been on the radar of the La Liga giants, with whom be came through their academy prior to moving to London, for months. Reuters 4 Hector Bellerin is reportedly open to a Barcelona move… Should Arsene Wenger leave 
And according to Mundo Deportivo , Barca have indicated that money would be no object for any potential deal. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Bellerin only signed a new six-and-a-half year deal with the Gunners in November, worth around £115,000-a-week. 
Manchester City tried to snatch the 21-year-old from Arsenal last summer, but the Spaniard decided to stay out of loyalty and his enjoyment of playing under Wenger. related articles EUROPA DRAW Manchester United await their fate for Europa League last 16 draw - Schalke, Ajax, Roma in the hat Europa League round-up Lyon thrash AZ Alkmaar 7-1 while a Pope-inspired Villarreal beat Roma 1-0... but lose on agg in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? However, according to the Guardian , Bellerin would seriously consider leaving Arsenal should the manager leave – with other key men like Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil’s future also coming into question. 
Ozil said as much when speaking to Kicker last month: “The club knows that I want to be clear what the manager is going to do [in the future].” 
Wenger is under increasing pressure to leave the club he has managed for over 20 years. Getty Images Hector Bellerin only signed a new deal with the Gunners in November Getty Images Bellerin’s future depends on whether under-pressure Wenger remains at the Emirates this summer Getty Images 4 Bellerin came through the youth system at Barcelona before joining Arsenal in 2011 
He has a two-year extension on the table but will wait until nearer the end of the season before making his decision.
